page.title: 17LANDSCAPE _ WEDMORE AREA
page.content: This area is mainly{lowland pasture, with many{RHYNES}or ditches. The village of{Wedmore}is situated in the south on a clay_capped hill. Climatically, the predominantly SW winds and the shadow effect of the Bristol Channel, produce a lower than expected rainfall. {Rhynes}are man_made water courses, built in the 14th century by monks to help drain the land. The water level is kept high in the summer months to allow the rhynes to act as fences and kept at a low level for the rest of the year to prevent flooding. Local farmers are responsible for the maintainence of the small ditches, Wessex Water Authority for the rhynes. The drainage system in this area is designed to take the water from the lowlands, via the rhynes and rivers, to the Bristol Channel.
